acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=4.2ppb of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Considering rabbit dermal LD50 = 9400mg/kg (RTECS (2003)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It was set as category 2 based on rat LC50 (4h) = 0.36mg/L (RTECS (2003)). In addition, it is presumed that the saturated concentration of this product is very low, and the inhalation test is done in mist conditions.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the value of LD50 = 834mg/kg calculated from the rat oral LD50 values : 980 (RTECS (2003), HSDB (2003)),  766 (RTECS (2003)) and 950mg/kg (HSDB (2003)), the substance was classified as Category 4.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is the report which suggests carcinogenic in a mouse (RTECS (2003)) and reports denies was seen (HSDB (2003)). But data is insufficient and it cannot taxonomic.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=5.98 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: Not classified because of no appropriate data on an explosibility, though the substance contains N-O bonds as chemical groups with explosive properties present and has the oxygen balance calculated at -184.4, higher than -200 of the criteria.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 4 because of its flash point: 67degC (PM, 13th, 2003, Pensky-Martens closed cup)

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there is the positive report in Ames test reporting (RTECS (2003)), other test results containing in vivo cannot be found. So it cannot be classified because of insufficient data

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Uses are agricultural chemicals, and even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since teratogenicity (cleft palate, torticollis, etc) was seen in fetal animals (Catalog of teratogenic agents (2004), RTECS (2003), HSDB (2003)) in the test on mice and hamsters, a possibility of causing malformation to humans was suggested in the animal studies (ICSC (J), (1997)). So it was set as Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Although the grouping relevant to explosive (N-O) was included, the grouping relevant to autoreactive was not included and the data in which autoreactive is indicated was not found, either. So it was considered outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there is the description that human skin is stimulated (ICSC (J), (1997), HSDB (2003)), it was set as category 2.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: By repetition or the long-term contact to the human skin, since there is a report of a patch test positivity (HSDB(2003)) in addition to there is a description that sensitization of the skin may be carried out (ICSC(J)(1997)), it was referred to as Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since there is a report that effect was observed in the liver function as a result of occupational exposure of this product (HSDB (2003) the document of Priority 2), and , that the hepatocyte necrosis was observed in the rat with given dose of the range of Category 2 in a guidance value (RTECS (2003) the document of Priority 2), it was classified into Category 2 (liver).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
